qas.question: How many miles is Guam across?

On what island is Anatahan located?

context: The island of Guam is <a0_0><b5_0>30 miles<b5_0/><a0_0/> (50 km) long and <b6_0>4 to 12 miles<b6_0/> (6 to 19 km) wide, 3⁄4 the size of <b3_0>Singapore<b3_0/>. The island experiences occasional <a1_0>earthquakes<a1_0/> due to its location on the western edge of the Pacific Plate and near the Philippine Sea Plate. In recent years, earthquakes with epicenters near Guam have had magnitudes ranging from 5.0 to <b4_0>8.7<b4_0/>. Unlike the Anatahan volcano in the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam is not volcanically active. However, due to its proximity to Anatahan, vog (i.e. <a2_0>volcanic smog<a2_0/>) does occasionally affect Guam.
